thread.section_title: News in Your South Florida City - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: New pastor refreshes at Boca's oldest church
thread.title_full: New pastor refreshes at Boca's oldest church - Sun Sentinel

author: Marci Shatzman
title: New pastor refreshes at Boca's oldest church

organizations.name: bethel a.m.e. church in moore haven

text:
Nothing like having a new pastor to revitalize the oldest church in Boca Raton .
The Rev. Troy K. Venning, 40, only needed two months at Macedonia A.M.E. Church in Pearl City to make more headway than the 100-year-old church had seen in a long time. "He's the greatest pastor, and what he did in eight weeks helped us redo the church," said Laura Albury, 76, a member for 70 years.
Venning took the bills in hand and had both restrooms replaced and the pastor's study updated, Albury said. "He showed love for all of us," she added.
"God told me to work on Macedonia before we can work on the outside," Venning told the congregation. "God blessed us to wipe out some bills and ... there was some stuff in the church office from 1918," he joked.
The Rev. Jessie Harvin Jr., presiding elder, said, "I made a recommendation and the bishop approved it. I know [Venning] from his work around the conference; we have 26 churches. ... We wanted a young pastor to fulfill the vision of the church in this community."
Caption Going inside the hive for a honey harvest Broward County Beekeeper’s Association President Dan Novak takes us with him as he harvests honey from his backyard bee hives.
Broward County Beekeeper’s Association President Dan Novak takes us with him as he harvests honey from his backyard bee hives.
Caption Watch these wiener dogs competing for the title of fastest dachshund More than 90 wiener dogs raced each other during the 5th Dachstoberfest in West Palm Beach. Puppies, seniors and adults competed for the title of "Fastest Dachshund."
More than 90 wiener dogs raced each other during the 5th Dachstoberfest in West Palm Beach. Puppies, seniors and adults competed for the title of "Fastest Dachshund."
"The goal is to expand and grow," said Venning, who formerly was senior pastor at Bethel A.M.E. Church in Moore Haven and communications minister at St. Paul A.M.E. Church in Miami. "It's exciting for me.
"This is a place where everyone is accepted. I plan to be inclusive," said Venning, who's also a radio personality. His "Life After Church" broadcast is 7 to 9 p.m. Thursdays on Strong Arm Radio at StrongArm.fm
Venning has degrees from Garrett-Evangelical Theological Seminary, Xavier University and the University of Phoenix. He was thrilled his ministry takes him closer to his home in Hollywood, he said.
He even has his parents on board for support. "I'll be here every Sunday from now on," said Linda Baldwin with her husband Alfred Baldwin, after a special service on Jan. 29. "Dream Encounters" included a choir from St. Paul and a sermon by church pastor the Rev. Dr. Robert Jackson III.
Grace Rance did the welcome for the service with a full house of members and visitors. "Troy asked people to hug, laugh and smile," she said to the congregation. "It feels good."
John E. Brown was there representing nearby Ebenezer Baptist Church in Pearl City. "This is our sister church, and we've had fellowship from the beginning. We just celebrated our 98th anniversary," said Brown, vice president of Developing Interracial Racial Social Change. "This is the oldest church in Boca Raton. No disputing that."
Macedonia A.M.E. Church is at 128 NE 11th St. in Boca Raton.
mshatzman@tronc.com
 Boca Raton
